metadata.title: CVE-2015-0248 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The (1) mod_dav_svn and (2) svnserve servers in Subversion 1.6.0 through1.7.19 and 1.8.0 through 1.8.11 allow remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (assertion failure and abort) via crafted parameter combinationsrelated to dynamically evaluated revision numbers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0248` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libapache2-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-java - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-perl - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn1 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
python-subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
ruby-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
subversion-tools - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: subversion package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2').
